meanings.definition: In a generous or forgiving manner.
meanings.sent1: She forgave her friend magnanimously for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: He always helps others magnanimously without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent3: The cat magnanimously shared its toy with the dog.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone magnanimously upon the fields, giving life to all.
meanings.sent5: The teacher smiled magnanimously at the student's honest confession.

meanings.definition: Showing a noble or courageous spirit.
meanings.sent1: The knight's magnanimously brave act saved the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Her magnanimously kind heart touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent3: The magnanimously lion protected the smaller animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood magnanimously tall against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The magnanimously oak tree provided shade for all creatures in the forest.

meanings.sent1: She donated magnanimously to the charity every year.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks magnanimously of others, never gossiping.
meanings.sent3: The bakery owner magnanimously gave out free pastries to the children.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed magnanimously, quenching the thirst of the land.
meanings.sent5: The old man smiled magnanimously at the young couple, wishing them well.
